intro: Fosbergia alleizettii, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame vine, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, often with a contrasting yellow throat. It typically grows as a shrub or vine, reaching heights of up to 10 feet, and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Fosbergia alleizettii is well adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii, often found in coastal areas and dry forests.
